Package coreapi

Class Menu

  • java.lang.Object
    • coreapi.Menu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Product
    public class Menu
extends java.lang.Object
implements Product
    Implementation of the Product interface representing a menu comprised of multiple products. Users of the API shouldn't use this class directly.
    Version:
    0.2
    Author:
    Fran, Borja

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Menu​(int assignedId, java.lang.String assignedName)
      Creates a new menu with the assigned numerical Id and name.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addProductToMenu​(Product product)
      Adds one unit of the specified product to the menu.
      void addProductToMenu​(Product product, int quantity)
      Add the specified amount of units of the specified product to the menu.
      int getId()
      Returns the identifier assigned to this menu.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of this menu.
      java.math.BigDecimal getPrice()
      Returns the combined cost of all products that make up this menu.
      int getProductQuantity​(int productId)
      Returns how much of a product is contained in this menu.
      java.util.List<Product> getProductsInMenu()
      Returns a read-only list containing the products that make up this menu.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Menu

        public Menu​(int assignedId,
            java.lang.String assignedName)
        Creates a new menu with the assigned numerical Id and name. The user of this class should be aware to assign a unique identifier to this menu, and to provide a user-friendly name for display.
        Parameters:
        assignedId - The numerical identifier to assign to this menu.
        assignedName - The name to assign to this menu.

      • getProductsInMenu

        public java.util.List<Product> getProductsInMenu()
        Returns a read-only list containing the products that make up this menu.
        Returns:
        Returns a list containing the products in the menu.
        See Also:
        List, Product

      • getProductQuantity

        public int getProductQuantity​(int productId)
        Returns how much of a product is contained in this menu. If the product doesn't exist within this menu, the returned value is zero.
        Parameters:
        productId - The id of the product to check.
        Returns:
        Returns the quantity of the product contained in this menu.

        See Also:
        Product

      • addProductToMenu

        public void addProductToMenu​(Product product,
                             int quantity)
        Add the specified amount of units of the specified product to the menu.
        Parameters:
        product - The product to add to the menu.
        quantity - How much of that product to add to the menu.
        See Also:
        Product
